intro: Talauma chocoensis, commonly known as the Chocoan talauma, is a species of flowering plant native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically display vibrant colors such as red, orange, or yellow. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in the understory of dense rainforest canopies. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its natural range.
